Great sequel to the original Portal game. I liked the humor in the previous game better, but this one is still funny. The gameplay improvements and new additions are welcome. The puzzles are more complex and clever, making them very satisfying to solve, even though some levels may feel a bit drawn-out or unnecessarily large.
Probably the BEST story i experienced in the last few years. Puzzles arent repetitive, voice acting is a gem, great humour, awesome game mechanics and worldbuilding. 10/10 game
GLaDOS roasts my intelligence, Wheatley destroys the facility, and I’m just standing there happy that my cube still loves me. A masterpiece.

Probably the best videogame of all time bar none

Just finished it after completing the first one, and it does what a sequel usually does: the same core mechanic, but with some new features such as different coloured gels to keep you interested. Stephen Merchant really adds some life and humour to proceedings, and it definitely feels like a fuller game than the first one. I still recommend playing Portal first, but there's no reason not to play both in sequence.

It's hella more adventurous and a lot more expanded when It comes to mechanics than previous title. Well written Main Antagonists, expanded lore, absolute cinematic story and puzzles that some feel very simple but will tickle your braincells a little and some which feel tiresome but those are mostly puzzles during the end game and after completion You will feel a need for another game that We will probably never get. They really made a worthy sequel to the series. The stages were more complex, new ways to traverse and use the map with, really genius use of jump, fast, water and portal liquid just made the stages really awesome. I still remember playing Portal 2 on my Xbox 360 when I was younger. Coming back to it after all these years felt like a real trip down memory lane. At first, I wasn’t sure if it would live up to my memories, but as soon as I started playing, it was clear. 

[b]This game is still a masterpiece![/b]

The puzzles and levels are brilliantly designed, and the story is captivating from start to finish. Every detail, from the voice acting to the level design, is carefully crafted. Even after all this time, Portal 2 holds up perfectly and fully deserves all the praise it has ever gotten.

Puzzle-type game where you move your character around and figure out how to get out of "test" areas by manipulating things like lasers, transporter beams, jump-pads, bounce slicks, speed slicks, and of course, portals. The game that ruined the best puzzle game ever for me. It explicitly characterises alot of details that were better left unknown from the first game. Because thats what kept me wondering and engaged.

This game does not justify it's existence, and It snuffed most of the mystery that I loved from the first game.
